definition: lit. doesn't (even) enter a single aperture (of one's head)/I don't understand a word (idiom)/it's all Greek to me
one/1/single/a (article)/as soon as/entire/whole/all/throughout/"one" radical in Chinese characters (Kangxi radical 1)/also pr. [yao1] for greater clarity when spelling out numbers digit by digit
hole/opening/orifice (of the human body)/(fig.) key (to the solution of a problem)
(negative prefix)/not/no
to go through/to know well/(suffix) expert/to connect/to communicate/open/to clear/classifier for letters, telegrams, phone calls etc
classifier for an activity, taken in its entirety (tirade of abuse, stint of music playing, bout of drinking etc)

sentences.english: The egghead in the university knows nothing about business.
sentences.chinese: 大学里的书呆子对生意一窍不通。

sentences.english: You’re sort of missing the entire ‘advertising is lying’ concept, Harry.
sentences.chinese: 你对‘广告就是谎言’这个概念根本一窍不通，哈利。

sentences.english: Suresh: I'm a geneticist . I wouldn't know the first thing about this.
sentences.chinese: 我是个遗传学家，我对医疗这方面一窍不通。

sentences.english: You might be a great writer but terrible at design.
sentences.chinese: 你也许是个很棒的作家，但却对设计一窍不通。

sentences.english: She offers up silly advice and is clueless about the latest fashion rage.
sentences.chinese: 她一无所知，老出馊主意，对流行时尚一窍不通。

sentences.english: It's no good talking to me about physics; it's a closed book to me.
sentences.chinese: 跟我谈物理等于白说，我对它一窍不通。

sentences.english: He does not understand finance at all.
I'm afraid we do know nothing about the song - writing business.
sentences.chinese: 恐怕我们对写歌的生意一窍不通吧？

sentences.english: I was even metaphor sentences are all thumbs.
sentences.chinese: 我那是连比喻句都一窍不通。

sentences.english: But she's a horrible singer and dancer.
sentences.chinese: 但她对唱歌和跳舞实在是一窍不通。

sentences.english: He is utterly ignorant of staff [stave].
Obviously he knows nothing about technology." –Jimmy Kimmel
sentences.chinese: 很显然，他对科技一窍不通。
我也对贴墙纸一窍不通。

sentences.english: She is just a pseud ; she knows nothing about art really.
sentences.chinese: 她不过是假称内行罢了，实际上对艺术一窍不通。

sentences.english: I did not know Cantonese at all and knew Mandarin only a little.
sentences.chinese: 广东话我一窍不通，中文也只识得少许。

sentences.english: She tried to explain her theories about modern poetry but it was Greek to me.
sentences.chinese: 她试图阐述她的现代诗歌理论，但我却一窍不通。

definition: layman
lit. to know one and understand half (idiom); a smattering of knowledge/dilettante/amateur
not knowing anything at all (idiom); completely ignorant/without an inkling
slight knowledge of sth/superficial acquaintance with a subject/a smattering
layman/amateur
slight knowledge of sth/to know very little about a subject/a smattering
to be proficient in/to master (a subject)
dabbler/smatterer/tactless and impulsive person
to not fully understand/to only partly understand
self-taught/to learn without a teacher (idiom)
different trades, worlds apart (idiom); to sb outside the profession, it is a closed book
to be confused/to be baffled
to be adept at sth/to be an expert in a trade or profession
switch to a job one was not trained for
connoisseur/expert
to know sth like the back of one's hand (idiom)/to know (a person, a place etc) inside out
variant of 了如指掌[liao3 ru2 zhi3 zhang3]
